answers.answer: To enroll in the pro-bono legal assistance program for Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries, one should contact local organizations offering such services or reach out to relevant authorities responsible for refugee support. These organizations may require personal information and documents as proof of their status as refugees.

These organizations may require personal information and documents as proof of their status as refugees. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help

answers.answer: CNRR provides free legal counseling services to refugees and asylum seekers in collaboration with UNHCR. They offer help on various legal issues and assist them with obtaining the necessary documents required during the process. The service is available through their dedicated hotline (+40730073170), WhatsApp, Telegram, and Viber. It operates from Monday to Friday between 8:00 AM and 10:00 PM, maintaining confidentiality.
